page.title: 16 THE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: There is a date stone on the front of the Primary School which says, "Free School_A.D. 1835". This year we are celebrating our 150th anniversary. It is probably the 400th anniversary of the first primary school in Long Sutton which was held in the South Porch of the church.By 1828 the school was not large enough to cope with the children so a new one was needed. In 1835 this school was built. The school was enlarged in 1843 and 1872. Girls and boys were taught seperately. Until 1952 children spent all their school life here. Then the Peele Secondary School was opened. In 1986, hopefully a new primary school will open Perhaps the old school will be demolished and an old folks' home built.
